de.uniheidelberg.cl.swp.testacr
Class PerformanceMeasurementMain

java.lang.Object
  de.uniheidelberg.cl.swp.testacr.PerformanceMeasurementMain

public class PerformanceMeasurementMain
extends java.lang.Object

This class handles the whole process of Feature Dependent Performance Measurement. The following steps are done:

  • Reads the Configuration and loads all the MMAX files in the specified directories.
  • Processes the MMAX files and extracts CoreferencePairs and Features.
  • Runs each ACR on each file
  • Performs the main Evaluation.

Method Detail

run

public void run()
         throws java.lang.Exception
Runs the whole evaluation pipeline.
All the parameters are set by configFile.

1. Get all ACR system which should be evaluated.
2. For each ACR system
- Get all the training files in the specified directory (see Configuration.
- Extract the basedata (raw words) and correct coreferences (gold standard)
- Split gold standard into CorefPairs
- Extract all features from CorefPairs (gold standard)
2.1 Run each acr systems in acrRunner.run()
2.2 Get predicted corefs by ACR-System
2.3 Measure performance.
3. Write the results to an .arff-File.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception

getMMAxFiles

public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMMAxFiles(java.lang.String directory)
Returns the mmaxFiles in the specified directory (either "Training" or "Test"). The value for the path is looked up via Configuration.

Parameters:
directory - Directory with MMAX files.
Returns:
A list of MMAX2 fileNames.
